#summary How to import blueprints from CSV

= Importing from CSV =
You can import blueprints by posting CSV into specialized window on blueprints tab. It is flexible, meaning that some fields are not necessary to specify and not-supported columns will be ignored.

== CSV fields ==
|| *name* or *typeID* || String || Either blueprint name or blueprint typeID must be specified ||
|| *ME* || Integer || Material level, optional ||
|| *PE* || Integer || Productivity level, optional ||
|| *itemID* || Integer || Blueprint itemID, optional ||

== Examples ==

Either name or typeID must be specified (not both!):
{{{
name,ME,PE,itemID
1MN Afterburner I Blueprint,50,50,1461877558
Damage Control I Blueprint,9,30,1627580639
}}}

{{{
typeID,ME,PE,itemID
1072,50,50,1461877558
2047,9,30,1627580639
}}}

Column order does not matter:
{{{
name,itemID,ME
1MN Afterburner I Blueprint,1461877558,50
Damage Control I Blueprint,1627580639,9
}}}

Column names are case-insensitive:
{{{
itemid,me,name
1461877558,50,1MN Afterburner I Blueprint
1627580639,9,Damage Control I Blueprint
}}}

By default ME=0 and PE=0:
{{{
name
1MN Afterburner I Blueprint
Damage Control I Blueprint
}}}

{{{
typeID
1072
2047
}}}

Unknown columns are ignored:
{{{
name,blah,region,station
1MN Afterburner I Blueprint,bad,column,name
Damage Control I Blueprint,bad,column,name
}}}

EveHQ needs some adjustments (remove top lines and change Blueprint to name):
{{{
EveHQ BP Manager Owned Blueprint Export

Blueprint,Location,Specific Location,Tech,ME,PE,Runs,Status
Eagle Blueprint,icydo's Secret BP Stash,icydo's Secret BP Stash,2,-4,0,BPO,Present
Dominix Blueprint,icydo's Secret BP Stash,icydo's Secret BP Stash,1,40,50,BPO,Present
}}}
{{{
name,Location,Specific Location,Tech,ME,PE,Runs,Status
Eagle Blueprint,icydo's Secret BP Stash,icydo's Secret BP Stash,2,-4,0,BPO,Present
Dominix Blueprint,icydo's Secret BP Stash,icydo's Secret BP Stash,1,40,50,BPO,Present
}}}
